content.text:
# List of international presidential trips made by Recep Tayyip Erdoğan

This is a list of international presidential trips made by Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, the 12th and current President of Turkey, since he assumed the presidency on 28 August 2014.
As of , Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has made 257 trips to 91 countries. The number of visits per country where he travelled are:
* 1 visit to Afghanistan, Angola, Argentina, Belarus, Brazil, Bulgaria, Chad, Chile, Colombia, Cuba, Czech Republic, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Ecuador, Equatorial Guinea, Estonia, Ethiopia, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea, Iraq, Ivory Coast, Jordan, Kenya, Latvia, Lithuania, Madagascar, Mali, Mauritania, Mexico, Moldova, Montenegro, Mozambique, Netherlands, Oman, Paraguay, Peru, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, South Africa, South Korea, Sudan, Switzerland, Tajikistan, Tanzania, Togo, Uganda, Venezuela, Zambia
* 2 visits to Bahrain, Croatia, Greece, India, Japan, Kyrgyzstan, Malaysia, Nigeria, Poland, Somalia, Spain, Tunisia, Vatican City
* 3 visits to Egypt, Indonesia, United Kingdom
* 4 visits to Albania, Algeria, Iran, Italy, Senegal, Serbia, Turkmenistan, United Arab Emirates
* 5 visits to Bosnia and Herzegovina, China, France, Kazakhstan, Pakistan, Ukraine
* 6 visits to Germany, Hungary, Kuwait, Uzbekistan
* 7 visits to Belgium
* 9 visits to Saudi Arabia
* 11 visits to Northern Cyprus
* 15 visits to Qatar, United States
* 16 visits to Russia
* 20 visits to Azerbaijan
Summary
2014
in Latvia, October 23, 2014]]

Multilateral meetings of the following intergovernmental organizations are scheduled to take place during Erdogan's term in office as president.
